creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: mountain landscape with two men in boat at lower center; large rocks with trees jut into calm bay; small huts just off shoreline at L; small building upper center of mountains; moon URQ; inscription URQ; white paint spots throughout resembling snow
inscription:
両峰岩風吹玉樹一灘明月照銀沙

(Aaron Rio, 10/31/2019)
medium: Hanging scroll; ink and color on paper
text: Yokoi Kinkoku painted in a rapid and spontaneous manner and was especially successful in capturing the vibrancy of mountains and rocks. Toward the end of his life he became a wandering Buddhist priest of the Jōdo (Pure Land) school. Irregularly and richly shaped, the mountains go high up in the painting. Black ink dotting and lively outlines give the rocks a rich texture.
title: Boating on a Snowy Evening
